column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Avoid
#Text=Spilling
#Text=It 's embarrassing to spill your drink , but sometimes it can seem unavoidable .
#Text=You may have a hand tremor so it is difficult to hold a cup or glass without spilling , or perhaps you 've just had too many accidents lately .
#Text=We 'll show how to walk with a cup , glass or plate without spilling .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Walk slowly .
#Text=Scientists have found that a cup of coffee just happens to be the right size to set up waves when we walk .
#Text=The faster one walks , the quicker and stronger the waves .
#Text=You know what happens next — flying coffee !
#Text=By walking slower , the sympathetic resonances are decreased , and your drink stays where it belongs .
#Text=Look at your drink .
#Text=Keep your eye on your drink , not your feet .
#Text=This not only helps you walk slower , by focusing on your drink you are constantly aware and making adjustments for any sloshing that 's going on .
#Text=Do n't rush .
#Text=The slower you start moving , the less the drink in your cup will start sloshing .
#Text=By not dashing from here to there , you make it easier to keep your drink in the cup , and not on the ground .
#Text=Be alert for others in the area , since a bump or even a close call can result in an accident .
#Text=Hold the cup or plate with both hands .
#Text=This makes it easier to control .
#Text=Make several trips instead of trying to carry a plate in one hand and a glass in the other .
#Text=Do n't carry drinks on an empty stomach .
#Text=Have a snack , or drink some juice and eat some fruit if you are going to an event where you 're to have food .
#Text=Holding anything on an empty stomach can be extra difficult .
#Text=Know which hand is steady and for what things .
#Text=If you 're using one hand to carry a beverage , use your steady hand .
#Text=If you 're using two hands , use the steady hand to control the sloshing , and the other hand as support .
#Text=Know your limits .
#Text=Soup is nearly impossible to carry on a cafeteria tray if you have a hand tremor .
#Text=Avoid it or soak a piece of bread in it .
#Text=Carry a cafeteria tray with one forearm under the tray .
#Text=Your forearm can be much steadier than your hands .
#Text=Also , either avoid putting tall drinks on a cafeteria tray or hold both the tray and the drink with one of your hands .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Try out various techniques at home , before trying these with others .
#Text=Do n't fill your glass to the rim .
#Text=Leave room for the inevitable sloshing .
#Text=Use a cup with a lid , especially when carrying coffee .
#Text=Spilling a soda on yourself — messy .
#Text=Spilling hot coffee on yourself — dangerous .
#Text=If all else fails , accept someone else 's help in carrying items or cutting up your food .
#Text=Place a spoon in your drink .
#Text=It will act as a baffle , and dampen the oscillation of the liquid .
